cip.render.util3d

Class Line3f

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.util3d.Line3f
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public final class Line3f
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A class representing a line in 3D of single precision (the elements are represented by float values), hence the name Line3f.

    This class implements the basic functionality for a 3D line required for rendering and 3D graphics use. Internally, the representation is an explicit parametric line specified as a start point and a direction vector. This class is patterned after and most code adapted from the CLine3f class of the JOEY toolkit written and distributed by Crisis in Perspective, Inc.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Field Detail

      • m_next

        public Line3f m_next

      • m_ptOrg

        public final Point3f m_ptOrg
        The starting point of the line.

      • m_vDir

        public final Vector3f m_vDir
        The direction of the line. NOTE: in typical use, the direction vector is normalized so that points a given distance from the starting point can be simply generated by adding the direction vector scaled by the distance to the starting point. However, normalization of the direction vector is not enforced by the Line3f class, and must be controlled by the user of the class.

      • Line3f

        public Line3f()
        Creates a new instance of Line3f.

      • Line3f

        public Line3f(Point3f ptOrg,
              Vector3f vDir)
        Creates a new instance of Line3f.
        Parameters:
        ptOrg - The origin of the line.
        vDir - The direction of the line. NOTE: the direction is used as given and is not normalized during initialization.

      • Line3f

        public Line3f(Point3f ptOrg,
              Point3f ptThru)
       throws ZeroLengthVectorException
        Creates a new instance of Line3f.
        Parameters:
        ptOrg - The origin of the line.
        ptThru - A point the line passes through. The direction of the line is from the origin to this point, and is normalized during initialization.
        Throws:
        ZeroLengthVectorException - This exception is thrown if the ptOrg and ptThru points are essentially identical (so close together that a meaningful direction cannot be determined).

      • Line3f

        public Line3f(Line3f lnInit)
        Creates a new instance of Line3f.
        Parameters:
        lnInit - The line this line will be set equal to.

    • Method Detail

      • setValue

        public Line3f setValue(Point3f ptOrg,
                       Vector3f vDir)
        Sets the value of the line to be a line starting at ptOrg and in the direction vDir.
        Parameters:
        ptOrg - The origin of the line.
        vDir - The direction of the line. NOTE: the direction is used as given and is not normalized during initialization.
        Returns:
        Returns this line initialized with the value set as specified.

      • setValue

        public Line3f setValue(Point3f ptOrg,
                       Point3f ptThru)
                throws ZeroLengthVectorException
        Sets the value of the line to be a normalized line starting at ptOrg and passing through ptThru.
        Parameters:
        ptOrg - The origin of the line.
        ptThru - A point the line passes through. The direction of the line is from the origin to this point, and is normalized during initialization.
        Returns:
        Returns this line initialized with the value set as specified.
        Throws:
        ZeroLengthVectorException - This exception is thrown if the ptOrg and ptThru points are essentially identical (so close together that a meaningful direction cannot be determined).

      • setValue

        public Line3f setValue(Line3f lnInit)
        Sets the value of the line to be equal to another line.
        Parameters:
        lnInit - The line this line will be set equal to.
        Returns:
        Returns this line initialized with the value set as specified.

      • normalize

        public Line3f normalize()
                 throws ZeroLengthVectorException
        Normalizes the line - specifically, this means that the direction vector of the line is normalized.
        Returns:
        Returns the line after normalization.
        Throws:
        ZeroLengthVectorException - Thrown if the length of the direction vector is so close to zero that the normalization operation is meaningless - i.e. the direction of the line to totally ambiguous.

      • pointAtDistance

        public Point3f pointAtDistance(Point3f pt,
                               float fDist)
        Get the point at some parametric distance along the line. If the line is normalized (i.e. the direction vector is normalized) the parametric distance is equal to the geometric distance from the origin of the line.
        Parameters:
        pt - The point at the parametric distance. This point is passed in so that the caller can decide whether this point is instantiated, borrowed, or part of the description of some other object.
        fDist - The parametric distance along the line.
        Returns:
        Returns pt.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Line3f ln)
        Tests another line, ln, for equality with this line.
        Parameters:
        ln - The line to be tested. This line is unchanged.
        Returns:
        Returns true if ln is equal to this line (identical in all components), and false otherwise.
